body:
Hi,


I've been using Savannah for b/rad:


http://savannah.nongnu.org/ 
http://savannah.nongnu.org/projects/brad


They offer CVS, website hosting (no dynamic scripts), 
mailing lists management and other goodies (bug tracking,
support tracking, task management, patch tracking)
Here is a FAQ about their services:
http://savannah.gnu.org/faq/?group=administration


I think they use Mailman for the MLs
http://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/brad/


The nicest thing is there is no commercial advertising.


It is not the kind of automated service like SF, there are
administrators who answer your queries. To accept the project
the Radiance licence needs to be compatible with GNU GPL
http://www.gnu.org/philosophy/license-list.html
so there will be somebody reviewing it and it usually takes
a couple of days.


I think I had a conversation with an administrator about the
Radiance license some time ago, and he said it is compatible.


Francesco
